name: 黃柏鈞
objective: This course aims to provide students the basic concepts and techniques of digital logic designs. In this course, students can expect to establish solid theoretical and practical backgrounds needed to build a computer system from scratch. Besides the textbook, we also include most recent research results so that students can keep up with the latest trend with industry. Please note that a considerable portion of the course materials and lectures will be given in English.
schedule:
1. Introduction (1): fundamental Boolean logic
2. Implementation technologies (1): transistor switches; NMOS, PMOS, CMOS; PLA, PAL; CPLD; CAD tools
3. Implementation technologies (2): MOSFET behaviors; voltage levels, dynamic operations, and power dissipation of logic gates; noise margin; transmission gates
4. Optimization of logical functions (1)
5. Optimization of logical functions (2)
6. Number presentation
7. Arithmetic circuits (1): adder and subtraction
8. Arithmetic circuits (2): multiplication and division
9. Combinational-circuit building blocks
10. Flip-Flops, registers, counters, and a simple processor (1)
11. Flip-Flops, registers, counters, and a simple processor (2)
12. Synchronous sequential circuits
13. Asynchronous sequential circuits
14. Digital system design
15. [Optional] Testing of logic circuits
16. [Optional] Modern memories
scorePolicy:
課堂參與 20%
作業 20%
期中考 30%
期末考 30%
materials:
1. Stephen Brown and Zvonko Vranesic, Fundamentals of Digital Logic with Verilog Design, McGraw-Hill Higher Education, 2002.
2. 林銘波，數位邏輯設計（Digital Logic Design），第五版，全華，一零四年。
